title: WindowsEvent
description: JSON Schema for Log Analytics table: WindowsEvent

Channel.description: The channel to which the event was logged.

Computer.description: The name of the computer on which the event occurred.

Correlation.description: The activity identifiers that consumers can use to group related events together.

EventData.description: Contains the event data parsed to dynamic type. If the parsing fails then this field will contain null and the RawEventData field will be populated.

EventID.description: The identifier that the provider used to identify the event.

EventLevel.description: Contains the severity level of the event.

EventLevelName.description: The rendered message string of the level specified in the event.

EventOriginId.description: VM ID obtained from the Azure Instance Metadata Service (IMDS).

EventRecordId.description: The record number assigned to the event when it was logged.

Keywords.description: A bitmask of the keywords defined in the event.

ManagementGroupName.description: Additional information based on the resource type.

Opcode.description: The opcode element is defined by the SystemPropertiesType complex type.

Provider.description: System Properties Type - Identifies the provider that logged the event.

RawEventData.description: The raw event XML when parsing fails. It's null when parsing successful.

SystemProcessId.description: Identifies the process that generated the event.

SystemThreadId.description: Identifies the thread that generated the event.

SystemUserId.description: The ID of the user who is responsible for the event.

Task.description: The task defined in the event.

TimeGenerated.description: The time stamp when the event was generated on the computer.

Version.description: Contains the version number of the event's definition.
